properties.Name: AssetAccountingRateOfReturn
properties.Description:
The Accounting Rate Of Return (ARR) is a profitability measurement from a conventional accounting standpoint which compares the required investment to future annual earnings associated with the Asset.

ARR advantages:

-  Simple to apply
-  Measure profitability
-  Number correlate to presentation on financial statements
-  Measure full useful life of asset

ARR disadvantages:

-  Does not consider time value of money
-  Use income data as opposed to cash flow data

Columns.Name: AssetId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Asset.

Columns.Name: PeriodStartDate
Columns.Description: The period start date for which the ARR is calculated.

Columns.Name: PeriodEndDate
Columns.Description: The period end date for which the ARR is calculated.

Columns.Name: InitialInvestmentAmount
Columns.Description: The initial investment made into the Asset.

Columns.Name: AssetLife
Columns.Description: The useful life of the Asset.

Columns.Name: CashInflowsPerYearAmount
Columns.Description: The amount of cash inflows per year associated with the Asset.

Columns.Name: AccountingRateOfReturn
Columns.Description: ARR = (Cash Inflows Per Year - Depreciation)/Initial Investment

Properties.Description:
The Accounting Rate Of Return (ARR) is a profitability measurement from a conventional accounting standpoint which compares the required investment to future annual earnings associated with the Asset.

ARR advantages:

-  Simple to apply
-  Measure profitability
-  Number correlate to presentation on financial statements
-  Measure full useful life of asset

ARR disadvantages:

-  Does not consider time value of money
-  Use income data as opposed to cash flow data
